qas.question: What are Jehovah Witnesses allowed to accept at their discretion?
What pre-formatted durable power of attorney documents are provided by the Watch Tower Society to prohibit?
What can Jehovah's Witnesses' members specify on the canned legal forms from the WTS?

answers.text: allowable fractions and treatments they will personally accept

qas.question: What cooperative arrangement did Jehovah's Witnesses establish?
The Hospital Liaison Committees serve to bridge between hospitals, medical professionals and who?
What is one of the Protestant religions who are fine with blood transfusions?
Who decides what the limit is for allowable fractions of blood plasma fractions?
What is one of the career paths many Jehovah's Witnesses choose to take?
Who do most Witnesses get guidance from in regards to how much blood plasma fractions they are willing to accept?

context: Though <b5_0>Jehovah's Witnesses<b5_0/> do not accept blood transfusions of whole blood, they may accept some <a0_0>blood plasma fractions<a0_0/> at their own discretion. The <b6_0><b8_0>Watch Tower Society<b8_0/><b6_0/> provides pre-formatted durable power of attorney documents prohibiting <a1_0>major blood components<a1_0/>, in which members can specify which <a2_0>allowable fractions and treatments they will personally accept<a2_0/>. Jehovah's Witnesses have established <a3_0>Hospital Liaison Committees<a3_0/> as a cooperative arrangement between <a4_0>individual Jehovah's Witnesses<a4_0/> and <b7_0>medical professionals<b7_0/> and hospitals.
